name: Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant hotel! The staff, rooms, cleanliness,pool - in fact, everything, was superb.
reviews.title: Star of the Keys

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a fly-drive in the Keys and undoubtedly this was one of the best hotels we stayed in.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Would thoroughly recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time staying overnight in the Keys. Loved this hotel. Rooms are clean and hotel staff so friendly and courteous. The only thing was the AC unit that made noise every time it went on and off. For the price payed per night, they should have a built in system. Pool was great and view was spectacular. Also, I expected my room to be cleaned the next morning but it wasn't. We had left early (8 am and came back at 1:30 pm). However, I must say they are very good with answering requests. Upon arrival, our TV wouldn't turn on. They immediately came to fix it. And when asked for extra towels, housekeeping was quick to bring extras. Would stay again at this hotel. BTW, parking is $22/day but so worth it. Price stays the same and you can go in and out as many times as you like. Otherwise, you will be paying for way overpriced parking elsewhere and good luck finding any!
reviews.title: fantastic location

reviews.text: great place to go scuba the best take a day trip out hyatt is friendly helpful staff
reviews.title: Wow! Probably the Best Place in Key West!

reviews.text: I just returned from a eight day say at the Hyatt (2nd time) and it was great. From the front desk on down the hotel staff is top of the line! Great location. You can rent Wave runners, scooters and electric cars from Hydrothunder on site, the pool and the Blue Mojito outdoor bar I don't know what more you could ask for. The bar staff were fantastic Cassandra, Jeramy, Andrea and of course Marshall made hanging out fun!! Even my room attendant Raindy left me a hand written note to let me know she would be off the following day but the other staff would take care of me, now that's service!!! Yes the Hyatt is a bit pricy but the saying "you get what you pay for" holds true. Thanks to all the staff for a great trip done well.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a two night stay in mid May and arrived to an almost full self-park parking lot. Luckily there was a space available otherwise I'm not sure how the hotel would have accommodated our car. Parking is included in the $22.50 mandatory daily resort fee. It was 3:00pm upon our arrival so after collecting our bags we walked up to check in. Surprisingly, out of season and on a Monday at 3pm, our room wasn't ready. The front desk staff told us they guarantee check in by 4pm so we left the bags with the bell hop and walked down to the Schooner Wharf bar for a few drinks. I was called on my cell phone at 3:59pm by the Hyatt and they let us know our room was ready.
reviews.title: It's All Good

reviews.text: We pre paid for a partial Gulf view room on Hyatt's website. They upgraded us to an ocean front room (3201) upon check in. It was a great room with two exposures, both the Gulf and the pool. All the reviews are accurate. It was clean, modern, and big. The AC unit in our room was a wall unit. It looked new and was very effective. It did make noise even on low but it was white noise that didn't bother us and I am a light sleeper. There was also a ceiling fan over the bed. The room had a mini fridge and came with toothpaste, mouthwash, all the hair and bath needs and two bottles of water a day. We also had a great balcony overlooking the water.
reviews.title: Nice, good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was fantastic. They offered light fare and any drink you could want. Service was good at the bar but I noticed the girl who was serving the pool deck seemed a bit overwhelmed at times. Often times we would just go to the bar ourselves as we couldn't get her attention. We did eat breakfast at the onsite restaurant Shore one morning. We were not impressed. It wasn't bad but just nothing spectacular. Go to Pepe's for the best breakfast in town and maybe the world. You can rent jet skis, arrange for tours, and rent any kind of bike, scooter, etc all on site.
reviews.title: 7th year in a row, keeps getting better

reviews.text: I have been to the hotel several times and recently returned this weekend. In a few words--this hotel really gets it. I have noticed that the staff has really molded together quite nicely and unlike the past when they have been there for a short time and left you are actually seeing the same and ulta professional faces again. It is running like a perfectly oiled machine with excellent response to all issues. Even during a sold out time they arranged for a wonderful partial ocean room, were accomodating in all aspects and we thoroughly enjoyed our time. I think the hotel enjoys the best location on the island and as others have said is the perfect size. Small enough for that wonderful boutique feel but big enough to give you the amenties people expect.
reviews.title: Excellent property with a staff that really cares

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Always a winner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd time here. Beautiful upscale property at the best location in Old Town. (Didn't like our other location at a B&B next to the "southernmost buoy") You won't have free breakfast here or a blue mojito at the pool bar under $12 but you will get pampered by housekeeping, front desk staff and unlimited use of the incredibly comfortable hammocks scattered throughout.
reviews.title: Great stay at a great hotel!

reviews.text: Our room was a 3rd floor corner room with two views of the ocean.Big and the bed was comfy. It had two AC units as well. One was noisy so we didn't use it at night.
reviews.title: Wow...fantastic!

reviews.text: I can't say anything about use of concierge services ie jetski, fishing etc. They were out of our budget. We were very happy with the excursions we used offsite. See my other reviews for ways to get on the water on a budget.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: My husband booked this resort for my Mom and I this past April to celebrate my college graduation and 40th birthday. We were not disappointed...greeted with champange and an early check in and when staff asked if we were celebrating something they assigned us to a room with a beautiful view (Room 2402). My husband did pay for a partial ocenview room but this room was the first room off the side of the ocaen front so really our view was a front view but we did have a smaller balcony which worked for the two of us.
reviews.title: A Celebration to Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our 5 day stay, we enjoyed spa treatmentts, dining, and the sunset sail through the Hyatt. All were wonderful and the staff were VERY friendly. We enjoyed lunch upon arrival at Shor's, enjoyed drink at the Blue Mojitio, and ate lunch by the pool on our last day there. We also enjoyed the sun deck and beach area.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know many have commented on the small beach area at the Hyatt...first, let me say if you are looking for a large sandy beach like Mexico, Bahamas, Hawaii, etc. you will not find this anywhere in Key West. There is a nice beach we went to at Fort Zachary Taylor but it doesn't compare to the above. The Hyatt does offer two seating areas that have sand bottoms and a large sun deck. We had to wait a little while the first day to get a spot in the sand but it wasn't bad. We didn't seem to be there during a busy time; however, I did see others saving chairs at the pool in the mornings...not suppose to but no one said anything. So, yes, beach areas are small but very clean and nice. Also, I think it depends on the time of year you visit, as mentioned we visited in April and we had sun at both the beach areas and pool most of the day. The pool was on the cold side and we never did go in but it felt good to cool off your feet and splash some water on you.
reviews.title: Best of slim pickings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the cleaniness...I am very picky and the rooms and resort grounds were very clean and nice. Maid service was not an issue and we called for extra towels, water, etc. and staff was always prompt.
reviews.title: Second stay here, different room...way different experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for location...you couldn't ask for anything better! No car needed! Right off Duvall street and there are stores such as a CVS within a short walk. All the big name stores are on the otherside of the island so a taxi would be needed but remember, Key West is 3 miles by 5 miles so it is quick and cost is low. Taxi from airport is 16 dollars...they go by zones because the island is small. When you come out of the airport there are taxi's lined up waiting for you. Also, no need to go to airport 2 hours ahead of time...1 hour max is needed. The airport is so small and only a certain number of flights come in and out daily so you may only be sharing the terminal with one other flight.
reviews.title: We had a great time..

aka: Hyatt Key West Hotel Key West
description: Located directly on the Gulf of Mexico with an small intimate beach and within walking distance of prime shops and attractions, Hyatt Key West Resort & Spa is a year-round resort housing 118 spacious rooms. Water activities abound, including parasailing, snorkeling, jet boats and waverunning from the hotel’s marina and sunset cruises and dive trips. An on-site StayFit@Hyatt exercise center, new Jala Spa facility, pool and private sunbathing beach areas and dock provide additional recreation. Bicycle and scooter rentals are also available. The full-service restaurant, SHOR American Seafood Grill, offers indoor and outdoor dining overlooking the Gulf of Mexico, while ample meeting space, including an expansive banquet room, make the resort ideal for conferences and destination events. The Blue Mojito Bar & Grill offers light bites, a variety of cocktails and beverages and the best sunset view in town. A $10 million renovationwas completed in Fall 2007 and has brought a fresh and stylish, modern aesthetic to the resort’s classic Key West charm, transforming the property into a “tropical modern” experience through its elegant integration of architecture, interiors and landscapes. Soothing, luminous colors punctuated by bold detailing impart an intimate spa-like quality throughout, supported by organic materials such as porcelain, bamboo, glass tile and stone. Both private and public spaces across the resort have been transformed, including all 118 guestrooms, the lobby, the pool area with three all-new white-canvas spa cabanas and the newly dubbed Blue Mojito Pool Bar & Grill and SHOR American Seafood Grill. The redesign has also introduced the all-new Jala Spa facility.
